channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title: 这十张图表比较了乔-拜登和唐纳德-特朗普的记录。谁更胜一筹？ 👇
item.description:
These ten charts compare Joe Biden’s record with Donald Trump’s. Who comes out better? https://t.co/HhlnLF5Gaa 👇

item.title: 介绍 El Boletín，我们关于拉丁美洲的新每周通讯。经济学人》的订阅者可在此注册，了解塑造这个迷人而复杂地区的各种力量 👇
item.description:
Introducing El Boletín, our new weekly newsletter on Latin America. Subscribers to The Economist can sign up here to understand the forces shaping a fascinating and complex region https://t.co/RWoFSQCbLF 👇

item.title: 纽约的房价高得惊人。事实上，它是北美最昂贵的城市。看看您的城市排名如何 👇

item.title: 为了在共和党领导层的反对声中推进乌克兰援助，美国众议院的立法者们考虑采用解除请愿的方式。我们将在 "美国政治大全 "中解释这一立法手段。
item.description:
To advance Ukraine aid amid opposition from Republican leadership, lawmakers in America’s House of Representatives have considered using a discharge petition. We explain the legislative manoeuvre in our A to Z of US politics https://t.co/2HjKrt0hkc pic.twitter.com/Pi3KdNU3rw

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 台积电在日本建厂的运气比在美国好。刁钻的工人和繁琐的手续使其在亚利桑那州的工作进展缓慢👇。
item.description:
TSMC is having more luck building in Japan than in America. Truculent workers and red tape have slowed its efforts in Arizona https://t.co/pKCffJPA8H 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

Markets have dealt young people a bad hand. They could be playing it better. This is how they should invest https://t.co/d9ZdbDDuW1 👇

item.title: 去年，有 4.3 万名来自俄罗斯、4.2 万名来自印度和 2.4 万名来自中国的移民过境。而在 2021 年，这一数字分别为 4100 人、2600 人和 450 人👇。
item.description:
Last year 43,000 migrants from Russia, 42,000 from India and 24,000 from China made the crossing. That’s up from 4,100, 2,600 and 450, respectively, in 2021 https://t.co/OwROJY4v1h 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: Refik Anadol 借助公众对人工智能的广泛兴趣，成为当下的艺术家。他的作品似乎无处不在，模糊了艺术与工程之间的界限 👇。
item.description:
Refik Anadol is riding widespread public interest in AI to become the artist of the moment. His work seems to be everywhere, blurring the boundaries between art and engineering https://t.co/xjtInXqRH4 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 冷战期间，西方情报机构资助作家，有时是非常优秀的作家。以下是六本你不知道的宣传书籍 👇
item.description:
During the cold war Western intelligence agencies subsidised authors, sometimes very good ones. Here are six books you didn’t know were propaganda https://t.co/w8WcSVNn1Z 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 金丝雀码头正在重塑自我。现在，伦敦人不再每周五天通勤，金丝雀码头区正在扩大其吸引力，以满足那些寻求居住或休闲场所的人们的需求。它能成功吗？ 👇
item.description:
Canary wharf is reinventing itself. Now that Londoners are not commuting five days a week, the district is broadening its appeal, to accommodate those seeking somewhere to live or let loose. Will it succeed? https://t.co/UNnDHsPScg 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 近 70% 的美国成年人超重，超过三分之一的人肥胖。 但美国也有健康美食--只要你知道去哪里找 👇
item.description:
Nearly 70% of American adults are overweight; over a third are obese.⁠ But America has healthy cuisines—if you know where to look https://t.co/JASWx0V6XV 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 大多数感染都是急性的。如果你能活下来，就可以像以前一样继续生活。然而，对于少数倒霉蛋来说，这并不是故事的结局。某些感染会有第二幕👇。
item.description:
Most infections are acute. If you survive you can carry on as before. For an unlucky few, however, that is not the end of the story. Certain infections have a second act https://t.co/hVBZlb5zhN 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 活到 120 岁正成为一个可以想象的前景。令人兴奋的是，这些额外的岁月将是健康的，但会产生广泛的影响👇。
item.description:
Living to 120 is becoming an imaginable prospect. Excitingly, those extra years would be healthy—but there would be wide ramifications https://t.co/iWYpT2YNxg 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: "他们还只是十几岁的孩子[......]他们真正想谈论的是男朋友、衣服以及他们如何不得不结交新朋友。
item.description:
“They are still just teenagers [..] what they really want to talk about is boyfriends, clothes and how they’ve had to make new friends.”

Photojournalist @pollybraden follows the journeys of three young Ukrainians forced to grow up in wartime https://t.co/vH474PUqdk

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 等待特朗普在美国国会众议院的重大新闻，但不要错过周一将进行辩论的这两起涉及社交媒体的第一修正案大案。我的最新文章 @《经济学家
item.description:
Awaiting big Trump news at SCOTUS, but don’t sleep on these two huge 1st Amendment cases involving social media up for argument on Monday. My latest @TheEconomist https://t.co/QEaYlOTfFM

item.title: "我们正在谈论的可能是人类历史的终结。不是历史的终结，只是人类主导部分的终结，"尤瓦尔-诺亚-哈拉里（Yuval Noah Harari）在一篇特邀文章👇 中谈到人工智能时说。
item.description:
“What we are talking about is potentially the end of human history. Not the end of history, just the end of its human-dominated part,” Yuval Noah Harari says of AI in a guest essay https://t.co/pA35bN0ptm 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 尽管 62% 的民主党人认为犯罪是总统最糟糕的特征之一，但只有 34% 的共和党人持相同看法 ⬇️

item.title: 尼基-海利在主场输给了唐纳德-特朗普。我们将解释为什么这位南卡罗来纳州前州长将在周六输掉本州的初选对决👇。
item.description:
Nikki Haley is losing to Donald Trump on home ground. We explain why the former governor of South Carolina is set to lose a primary showdown in her state on Saturday https://t.co/rn2bSJB02R 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 2021 年 7 月，弗拉基米尔-普京（Vladimir Putin）发表了一篇文章，在 1000 年的历史中狂奔，声称俄罗斯人和乌克兰人是一个民族。这七张地图展示了他对过去的歪曲👇。
item.description:
In July 2021 Vladimir Putin published an essay that raced through 1,000 years of history to argue that Russians and Ukrainians are one people. These seven maps demonstrate his distortion of the past https://t.co/u5Wx7HSXWf 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 从 1000 年到 1600 年的中世纪并非一成不变的落后时代。一本新书表明，中世纪在社会和经济进步方面迈出了巨大步伐，为现代世界奠定了基础👇。
item.description:
The medieval period, from 1000 to 1600, was not a backward and unchanging time. A new book shows that huge steps in social and economic progress were made, laying the foundations of the modern world https://t.co/V20gH4Omdy 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 日本女人有力量。日本男人不知道自己是什么 👇

Japanese women are empowered. Japanese men don’t know what they are https://t.co/04UPlB2CkO 👇

item.title: 俄罗斯的威胁与日俱增，但西方的威慑力却在减弱。美国对乌克兰的支持正在动摇，而唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）也对他是否会在俄罗斯发动攻击后站在欧洲一边表示怀疑。
item.description:
The Russian threat is growing, but Western deterrence is weakening. American support for Ukraine is wavering, and Donald Trump has cast doubt on whether he would rally to Europe’s side following a Russian attack.

Europe needs to get its act together https://t.co/9rUTlO8a13 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024
